column2: A piece of cloth covering the lower face to protect from breathing in dust or prevent identification.
A thick piece of cloth wrapped around the head.
A dried and folded leather headband designed to protect the forehead.
A simple hood to protect against weather and scratches.
A rectangle shaped hat with a pheasant feather attached to it.
A crude hat to protect against the sun.
A fancy feathered hat usually worn by minstrels or nobles.
A tough leather hat providing decent protection against scratches.
A closed leather cap that protects the head and neck. Padded for extra protection.
The dried and prepped head of a large bear. Offers some protection, but is mostly donned for the looks.
A thick leather helmet fashioned from cured hides. The animals these once belonged to were certainly dangerous game.
A sturdy leather cap that is not covering the ears and neck.
A headpiece with long horns, fashioned in tradition of barbarian beastmasters for generations.
A thick leather hood that covers the head and neck but limits vision.
A thick leather hat with ornaments and feathers.
A metal helmet with added noseguard and a padded coif underneath.
A full-metal helmet with a broad rim.
A flat full-metal helmet with noseguard and a padded coif underneath.
A nordic helmet guarding face and neck with additional metal plates.
A dented metal nasal helmet that has seen some fighting.
A metal sallet helmet with an extended neckguard.
A flat full-metall helmet with noseguard.
A full-metal helmet with a broad rim and a padded coif underneath.
A mail coif that also protects the neck.
A nasal helmet with an attached mail neck guard fashioned in the way of the steppe folks.
A worn and used helmet with a rusty mail coif.
A metal bascinet worn atop a thick mail coif.
A full-metall helmet with a broad rim and a mail coif underneath.
A metal helmet with added noseguard and a mail coif underneath.
A metal helmet with a noseguard and a closed mail coif underneath.
A mail coif with added protection for the face.
A closed metal helm with breathing holes.
A sturdy yet light barbute helmet.
A heavy conic helmet with a full closed mail skirt for additional protection.
A closed helmet with complete faceguard and mail coif covering the neck.
This conic helmet with mail has an attached metal faceguard.
This heavy metal helmet also protects the wearer's face.
A closed metal helm with breathing holes and intricate decoration on top.
This heavy helmet has ornamental horns attached.
A simple cloth tunic. Fashionable but offering little in protection.
A leather apron usually worn by apprentices and craftsmen.
A rugged, large robe made of simple cloth usually worn by monks and similar individuals who don`t care fashion.
A fine linen tunic of exquisite material, embroided with pleasing patterns. Fashionable but offering little in protection.
Various patches of rough leather sewn together.
A rugged apron worn by butchers to protect against accidental cuts.
A cloth robe covered in all kinds of mystical ornaments and symbols.
A padded leather mantle stuffed for added protection. Usually worn under armor.
A thick cloth tunic consisting of multiple layers to protect against weather and scratches.
Heavy hides patched together to create a decent makeshift armor.
A dark padded leather mantle, stuffed for added protection, with a pelt coat.
This armor is pieced together from scavenged metal parts that are fixed to a crude leather tunic.
A thick leather armor covered with additional leather patches and occult insignia.
A leather vest on top of a cloth tunic for improved protection.
Thick furs that are crudely dried and tied together to protect from both the cold and any incoming blows.
A sturdy and heavy padded tunic that offers decent protection.
Numerous overlapping leather plates provide decent protection for most of the upper body.
A padded gambeson that has been repaired and patched a lot of times.
A padded tunic reinforced with leather fittings for added protection.
A mail shirt worn under a thick leather scale armor for added protection.
A reinforced animal hide armor fashioned from thick leather pieces with added mail and metal scales.
A heavy body armor made from thick iron scales.
A sturdy yet flexible armor composed of small, overlapping metal scales.
A mail shirt with shoulder guards providing excellent protection against most weapons.
This light mail shirt has seen better times but still grants decent protection.
A reinforced mail shirt that lost some parts over the years.
A basic and simple mail shirt. Offers decent and affordable protection against slashing and piercing attacks.
A skillfully crafted mail shirt with the pelt of a giant wolf on top. Donning the skin of a beast like this means shedding human fears.
A long and heavy chainmail that offers maximum protection but is very fatiguing to wear.
A body armor made of thick overlapping metal plates that cover most of the upper body.
A body vest with overlapping scales worn over a small mail shirt.
One layer of padding, one layer of strong mail, and heavy metal plates riveted ontop. A very heavy armor that offers great protection.
A heavy lamellar armor that covers most parts of the body with thick, overlapping metal plates for maximum protection.
A long and leather coat reinforced with metal plates over a sturdy mail hauberk.
A heavy armor made of thick, overlapping metal scales covering most of the body.
A mail hauberk reinforced with shoulder pauldrons and a rivetted leather armor for added protection.
A heavy armor that is made from mostly metal.
A mail hauberk reinforced with shoulder pauldrons, additional metal plating and a riveted leather armor, covered with a tabbard in a noble houses' colors.
This armor is made from heavy metal plates, scales and pieces of chainmal.
A pointy dagger made for close quarter combat.
A short knife, not made for combat.
A long, quadrangular spike designed to pierce through weakpoints in armor.
A short raw iron sword with some dents and notches, easy to wield in one hand.
An exotic curved sword from the south that is excellent for slashing, but not well suited for thrusting and penetrating armor.
A curved sword best suited for slashing and cutting unarmored opponents.
A simple wooden stick, usually an improvised weapon.
A spiked metal head on a wooden shaft, crude but effective in bashing in heads.
A wooden shaft with a spiked metal head used to deliver a combination of blunt-force and puncturing blows.
A simple wooden spear with a metal tip.
A short and heavy spear with two wings behind the bladed tip.
A long and sturdy spear built for battle.
A crude axe with a short shaft and an iron head.
A one handed axe with a medium long shaft and a refined head.
An axe explicitly designed for fighting armored opponents. Quite sturdy.
Two large sticks attached with a short chain, the Wooden Flail is an agricultural tool used to strike piles of grain to loosen the husks.
Two large sticks attached with a short chain and reinforced with metal, the Reinforced Wooden Flail is an agricultural tool turned weapon.
A seperate striking head attached to a handle by a chain. A rather unpredictable weapon, but useful to strike over or around shield cover.
A tool with a thick rectangular blade used for hacking through meat and bone.
A long knife with a one sided blade used for slashing and hacking.
A large, sharpened metal blade designed to deal devastating blows.
A hard head made from metal attached to a wooden handle, the Pickaxe is a miner's tool used to break up rocks. As an improvised weapon it's unwieldy but can deliver fatal injuries even through armor.
A wooden shaft with a long and pointy metal head designed to puncture the sturdiest of armors.
A short iron warhammer that easily batters through armor plates.
A pointy dagger made for close quarter combat.
A short knife, not made for combat.
A long, quadrangular spike designed to pierce through weakpoints in armor.
A short raw iron sword with some dents and notches, easy to wield in one hand.
An exotic curved sword from the south that is excellent for slashing, but not well suited for thrusting and penetrating armor.
A curved sword best suited for slashing and cutting unarmored opponents.
A simple wooden stick, usually an improvised weapon.
A spiked metal head on a wooden shaft, crude but effective in bashing in heads.
A wooden shaft with a spiked metal head used to deliver a combination of blunt-force and puncturing blows.
A simple wooden spear with a metal tip.
A short and heavy spear with two wings behind the bladed tip.
A long and sturdy spear built for battle.
A crude axe with a short shaft and an iron head.
A one handed axe with a medium long shaft and a refined head.
An axe explicitly designed for fighting armored opponents. Quite sturdy.
Two large sticks attached with a short chain, the Wooden Flail is an agricultural tool used to strike piles of grain to loosen the husks.
Two large sticks attached with a short chain and reinforced with metal, the Reinforced Wooden Flail is an agricultural tool turned weapon.
A seperate striking head attached to a handle by a chain. A rather unpredictable weapon, but useful to strike over or around shield cover.
A tool with a thick rectangular blade used for hacking through meat and bone.
A long knife with a one sided blade used for slashing and hacking.
A large, sharpened metal blade designed to deal devastating blows.
A hard head made from metal attached to a wooden handle, the Pickaxe is a miner's tool used to break up rocks. As an improvised weapon it's unwieldy but can deliver fatal injuries even through armor.
A wooden shaft with a long and pointy metal head designed to puncture the sturdiest of armors.
A short iron warhammer that easily batters through armor plates.
Small axes to be thrown in an overhand motion towards a target. Heavy enough to inflict serious damage to armor and shields from range.
A couple of light throwing spears usually carried by skirmishers.
Lighter than a common spear, but heavier than a javelin, this weapon is intended to be thrown over short distances.
A small but sturdy shield gripped in the fist.
A triangular wooden shield covered with leather and canvas.
An elongated wooden shield covered in leather that offers good protection also to the lower body.
A tall and heavy tower shield that offers good protection, but is very bulky to handle.
A two-handed variant of the sword with a long and thin blade, sharpened only on one side, and no crossguard. Can be used both for quick slashes and sweeping strikes.
A long two-handed blade that makes for a versatile weapon.
A long two-handed blade as good for crushing as for cutting.
A massive wooden club with a spiked head.
A huge club fitted with a skull for good measure.
A large and heavy winged mace held with both hands..
A metal-reinforced club with a spike at the top. Can be used to thrust at the enemy, or pummel them into submission.
A pitchfork re-forged into a battlefield weapon that is a cross between a spear and a pike.
A cross between a spear and a pike, making for a good defensive weapon.
A long, two-handed axe that bears down heavy with every swing. Held with both hands it is used to cut down large trees, but will cut down men just as well.
A heavy and long two-handed axe designed for battle that bears down heavy with every swing and can easily cut a man in two.
A relatively thin blade on a very long shaft used for devastating cutting attacks.
A heavy two-handed wooden flail that can strike over or around shield cover.
A massive iron chain with a solid full metal head at the end.
A large and heavy metal flail that required two hands to use. Useful to strike over or around shield cover.
A heavy blade with a curved end combining sword and axe into a devastating two-handed cleaver.
A heavy blade with an oddly curved end, combining the qualities of a sword and axe into a devastating two-handed cleaver.
A large wooden mallet that is held with both hands.
A large and heavy hammer held with both hands.
A warhammer mounted on a long pole.
An agricultural tool with a long handle and thick pointed tines used to lift and pitch straw.
A long pike used for thrusting over some distance and keeping the enemy at bay.
A pike-like weapon with a blade for striking over some distance and a hook attached for pulling in targets.
A simple wooden short bow with short range.
A simple wooden hunting bow with medium range.
A long bow with massive pulling power.
A lighter variant of a pull-lever crossbow that can propel bolts over medium distances.
A pull-lever crossbow that can propel bolts over medium distances.
A heavy crossbow with a crank that can propel bolts over medium distances and is effective even against heavily armored targets.
A horse used for travelling, fighting, and dragging carriages.
Gems meant to be sold for profit.
Amber meant to be sold for profit.
Beer meant to be sold for profit.
Berries meant to be sold for profit.
Bread meant to be sold for profit.
Bricks meant to be sold for profit.
Cheese meant to be sold for profit.

Copper meant to be sold for profit.

Dyes meant to be sold for profit.

Mushrooms meant to be sold for profit.
Porkribs meant to be sold for profit.
Salt meant to be sold for profit.
Spirits meant to be sold for profit.
Venison meant to be sold for profit.
Wine meant to be sold for profit.
Wood meant to be sold for profit.

An eery skull carved from a single large crystal. No scratch or other mark can be seen on its surface. Just being near it kills the fire of determination in almost any man, breaks hope and lets sprout doubts.
Does not have an offhand weapon equipped
Does not have a twohand weapon equipped
